comment.text: May be involved in both signal transduction and cellular adhesion in the CNS.
Expressed in colon, lung, heart and testis, as well as in fetal and adult brain. Not detected in muscle and peripheral blood leukocytes.
Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family. Receptor class 2B subfamily.

property.value: Expressed in middle temporal gyrus and 108 other tissues
F:transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase activity
P:homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules
P:negative regulation of receptor signaling pathway via STAT
P:peptidyl-tyrosine dephosphorylation involved in inactivation of protein kinase activity
P:transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase signaling pathway

feature.description: In a colorectal cancer; reduced phosphatase activity.

In an acute myeloid leukemia sample; somatic mutation.
In a lung cancer; reduced phosphatase activity.

Found in a patient with severe intellectual disability, behavioral problems, microcephaly, congenital cardiac defect and herniation of the abdominal diaphragm; also observed in some colorectal cancers; reduced phosphatase activity; unknown pathological significance; dbSNP:rs199947379.
